info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 3:55AM EDT until May 13 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Nuisance flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Abbeville and Greenwood.
* WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. A small culvert washout or two is possible.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 347 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate that heavy rain from earlier thunderstorms has ended across Abbeville and Greenwood counties. Numerous areas of flash flooding were reported over Greenwood County, but this flash flooding has ended. The floodwaves have moved through smaller streams are is now moving through the larger streams, including Wilson Creek, Coronaca Creek, Ninety Six Creek, and Hard Labor Creek. Nuisance flooding may continue along these streams for a few more hours. An additional round or two of brief moderate rainfall is possible through the early morning hours, but additional heavy rainfall capable of causing new flooding to develop is not expected. Therefore, this Flood Advisory will remain in effect for the next 1-4 hours to allow streams to recede back below bankfull levels. - Some locations that may continue to experience nuisance flooding includes... Greenwood, Abbeville, Ware Shoals, Cokesbury, Hodges, Troy, Shoals Junction, Promised Land, Bradley, and Coronaca. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
